Question Text: You are creating a new WLAN with the controller GUI, which of the following parameters are necessary? (Choose two)
Choices:
a. VLAN number
b. SSID
c. Interface
d. BSSID
e. IP subnet
LLM Explanation: When creating a new WLAN with the controller GUI, the two necessary parameters are:a. VLAN number - This specifies the VLAN to which the WLAN should be mapped. Each WLAN needs to be associated with a VLAN for client traffic segmentation.  b. SSID (Service Set Identifier) - This is the network name that will be broadcasted to clients. It uniquely identifies the WLAN.The other options are not mandatory:c. Interface is not required during WLAN creation.d. BSSID (Basic Service Set Identifier) is automatically generated based on the access point's MAC address.e. IP subnet is not a direct parameter in WLAN configuration.
URLs: ['CCNA Wireless 200-355 Official Cert Guide, Chapter 6: Understanding a Basic Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Configuration', 'https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-5/config-guide/b_cg85/wlan_interfaces.html']
SM - Description: VLAN is not necessary, since it is already associated with the interface. Interface is what you specify
